content.raw:
Wouldn't this be too spammy? In my view, a lot of plugins use default values, and I personally wouldn't like to see the log full of messages just about using default values.

It is true that most plugins don't have good documentation about the SDF parameters they take, so the only way to tell what's a parameter used for is actually looking into the source code of its implementation. Printing the default values to `gzmsg` might help a bit when the user is confused about what value is actually used, but I think `gzdbg` does almost the same thing.
content.html:
Wouldn't this be too spammy? In my view, a lot of plugins use default values, and I personally wouldn't like to see the log full of messages just about using default values.

It is true that most plugins don't have good documentation about the SDF parameters they take, so the only way to tell what's a parameter used for is actually looking into the source code of its implementation. Printing the default values to gzmsg might help a bit when the user is confused about what value is actually used, but I think gzdbg does almost the same thing.
